raw.title: [ARFC] Add fUSDC to Ethereum v3
raw.author: 0x329c54289Ff5D6B7b7daE13592C6B1EDA1543eD4
raw.body:
---
title: [ARFC] Add fUSDC to Ethereum v3
author: @marczeller - Aave-Chan Initiative
created: 2023-05-23
---

## Summary

This ARFC presents the community with the opportunity to add fUSDC to the Ethereum v3 Liquidity Pool.

## Abstract

fUSDC is a yield-bearing token representing USDC deposits in Flux, a fork of Compound V2. Adding fUSDC to Ethereum v3 would allow fUSDC holders to borrow stablecoins on Aave and leverage their fUSDC position, boosting the stablecoin utilization rate on Aave, while attracting new stablecoin deposits thanks to boosted supply rates.

## Motivation

fUSDC is a new financial primitive with arguably the best risk-adjusted yield available in DeFi. Adding support for fUSDC on Ethereum V3 in isolated mode would allow fUSDC holders to borrow stablecoins on Aave and leverage their fUSDC position, boosting the stablecoin utilization rate on Aave, while attracting new stablecoin deposits thanks to boosted supply rates.

## Specification

Ticker: fUSDC

Contract Address: `[0x465a5a630482f3abd6d3b84b39b29b07214d19e5](https://etherscan.io/address/0x465a5a630482f3abd6d3b84b39b29b07214d19e5)`

| Parameter | Value |
| --- | --- |
| Isolation Mode | Yes |
| Borrowable | No |
| Collateral Enabled | Yes |
| Supply Cap | 220M (~$4.45M) |
| Borrow Cap | N/A |
| Debt Ceiling | $1M |
| LTV | 77% |
| LT | 79% |
| Liquidation Bonus | 4.5% |
| Liquidation Protocol Fee | 20% |
| Variable Base | 0.00% |
| Variable Slope1 | 4.00% |
| Variable Slope2 | 60.00% |
| Uoptimal | 90.00% |
| Reserve Factor | 10.00% |
| Stable Borrowing | Disabled |

## Next Steps

- If the ARFC snapshot vote passes, move the proposal to the Aave Improvement Proposal (AIP) stage for final approval and implementation.

## Disclaimer

@marczeller and the Aave-Chan Initiative are not associated with or compensated by Flux Finance for publishing this AFRC.

## Copyright

Copyright and related rights waived via [CC0](https://creativecommons.org/publicdomain/zero/1.0/).

raw.title: [ARFC] Add MAI to Optimism Aave V3 pool
raw.author: 0x329c54289Ff5D6B7b7daE13592C6B1EDA1543eD4
raw.body:
---
Title: [ARFC] Add MAI to Optimism Aave V3 pool
Author: @marczeller - Aave-Chan Initiative
Date: 2023-04-13
---

# Summary

This proposal presents Aave with the opportunity to onboard MAI to the Optimism Aave V3 Market.

# Abstract

MAI is a decentralized stablecoin minted by the Qidao Protocol. For more details about MAI, please refer to [Qidao's official website](https://www.mai.finance/).

# Motivation

Supporting stablecoin diversity is part of the Aave-Chan Initiative (ACI) delegate platform. The risk parameters provided are the same as those adopted on the Polygon PoS Aave V3 Pool.

The newly proposed risk parameters replicating the MAI parameters on Polygon V3 pool are merely suggestions to start the conversation. The ACI is inviting Risk Service Providers to provide feedback on them.

# Specification

Ticker: MAI
Contract Address: 0xdFA46478F9e5EA86d57387849598dbFB2e964b02

| Risk Parameter        | Value    |
| --------------------- | -------- |
| Isolation Mode        | YES      |
| Enable Borrow         | YES      |
| Enable Collateral     | NO       |
| Loan To Value         | 75%      |
| Liquidation Threshold | 80%      |
| Liquidation Bonus     | 5%       |
| Reserve Factor        | 20%      |
| Liquidation Protocol Fee | 10%    |
| Borrow Cap            | 1,200k   |
| Supply Cap            | 2,200k   |
| Debt Ceiling          | 2,000k   |
| Base                  | 0%       |
| Slope1                | 4%       |
| Uoptimal              | 80%      |
| Slope2                | 75%      |

# Disclaimer

The ACI is not affiliated with Qidao or any other entity and has not received payment to present this ARFC.

At the time of writing, the author (@marczeller) owns QI & vQI, the native asset of the Qidao Protocol, for ~50k$. The author was not paid to publish this ARFC.

# Next Steps

1. If consensus is reached, submit an Aave Improvement Proposal (AIP) to onboard MAI on the Optimism Aave V3 pool.

# Copyright

Copyright and related rights waived via [CC0](https://creativecommons.org/publicdomain/zero/1.0/).

cleaned.title: [TEMP CHECK] Aave V3 "MVP" Deployment on GnosisChain
cleaned.author: 0x329c54289Ff5D6B7b7daE13592C6B1EDA1543eD4

raw.title: [TEMP CHECK] Aave V3 "MVP" Deployment on GnosisChain
raw.author: 0x329c54289Ff5D6B7b7daE13592C6B1EDA1543eD4
raw.body:
---
Title : [TEMP CHECK] Aave V3 "MVP" Deployment on GnosisChain

Author : Marc Zeller @marczeller - Aave Chan Initiative

Date : 2023-08-16

---

## Summary

This TEMP CHECK proposes the deployment of an Aave V3 pool on GnosisChain. The assets considered for this deployment include wETH, wstETH, GNO, USDC, wxDAI, and EURe.

## Motivation

Aave & GnosisChain with the upcoming deployment of GnosisPay L2 payment system and GnosisCard product have strategic synergies opportunities. Allowing users to “deposit as collateral, borrow and spend with Gnosis” seamless and near-zero fees experience.

GnosisChain has been a historic actor in the ecosystem, with its roots tracing back to the POA network. 

This proposal builds upon the precedent of synergies between the Aave codebase and the gnosischain as illustrated by the friendly fork RMM Market with RealT, as seen [here](https://rmm.realtoken.network/).

This “MVP” deployment opens the gates for deeper synergies between the Gnosis & Aave ecosystems in the future.

## Specification

The proposed deployment on GnosisChain will include the following assets:

| Risk Parameter | wETH | wstETH | GNO | USDC | wxDAI | EURe |
| --- | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- |
| Isolation Mode | NO | NO | YES | NO | NO | NO |
| Enable Borrow | YES | YES | NO | YES | YES | YES |
| Enable Collateral | YES | YES | YES | YES | YES | NO |
| Emode Category | N/A | N/A | N/A | N/A | N/A | N/A |
| Loan To Value | 80.5% | 69% | 25% | 77% | 77% | N/A |
| Liquidation Threshold | 83% | 80% | 28% | 80% | 80% | N/A |
| Liquidation Bonus | 5% | 6% | 10% | 4.5% | 4.5% | N/A |
| Reserve Factor | 15% | 15% | N/A | 10% | 10% | 15% |
| Liquidation Protocol Fee | 10% | 10% | 10% | 10% | 10% | 10% |
| Supply Cap | 7500 wETH | 2000 wsETH | 300000 | 5M USDC | 10M xDAI | 3.5M EURe |
| Borrow Cap | 7500 wETH | 500 wstETH | N/A | 5M USDC | 10M xDAI | 3.5M EURe |
| Debt Ceiling | N/A | N/A | 5M$ | N/A | N/A | N/A |
| uOptimal | 90% | 45% | N/A | 90% | 90% | 90% |
| Base | 0% | 0% | N/A | 0% | 0% | 0% |
| Slope1 | 3.8% | 3.8% | N/A | 3.5% | 5% | 5% |
| Slope2 | 80% | 80% | N/A | 60% | 60% | 60% |

Even if both assets currently lack the maturity to be considered, the ACI is supportive mid-term of adding both wGHO and sDAI onboarding in the GnosisChain V3 pool.

## Disclaimer

The Aave Chan Initiative is not affiliated with or paid by any third parties to publish this TEMP CHECK.
The ACI, as an entity, is a customer of Monerium. (EURe)

## Next Steps

1. If TEMP CHECK snapshot outcome is YAE, escalate to ARFC stage. and create a deployment checklist process.
2. If ARFC stage requirements are met, escalate to ARFC snapshot
3. If ARFC Snapshot outcome is YAE, Publish a deployment AIP.

## Copyright

Copyright and related rights waived via [CC0](https://creativecommons.org/publicdomain/zero/1.0/).

raw.title: [ARFC] increase borrow cap for MAI Aave Polygon V3
raw.author: 0x329c54289Ff5D6B7b7daE13592C6B1EDA1543eD4
raw.body:
title: [ARFC] increase caps for MAI Aave Polygon V3

Author: @marczeller - Aave Chan Initiative

Dated: 2023-02-02

Summary
MAI is a decentralized overcollateralized stablecoin minted by the QiDAO protocol

MAI is minted by qiDAO protocol users by locking collateral in vaults.

For more information about MAI please refer to MAI V3 ARC 2

This ARFC presents the Aave governance with the opportunity to increase MAI borrow cap on the Aave V3 polygon market.

Abstract
This ARFC proposes to increase the MAI borrow cap to 1M MAI to reflect market demand for this asset.

Motivation
Due to market demand for MAI liquidity, MAI utilization is close to borrow cap, and the current borrow cap is set at a level that has a probable effect on both MAI supplied (total cap making it impossible to reach uOptimal at the current level of liquidity) and drives out potential demand.

Allowing an increase of this borrow cap will allow supply and demand to find another equilibrium for the benefit of liquidity providers, borrowers & protocol revenue with expected increased borrow demand.

The new proposed cap is set at a level that allows the market to find this new equilibrium while maintaining a conservative approach.

Specification
Ticker: MiMATIC (MAI)

Contract Address: 0xa3Fa99A148fA48D14Ed51d610c367C61876997F1

Risk Parameter	Value
Isolation Mode	YES
Enable Borrow	YES
Enable Collateral	YES
Loan To Value	75%
Liquidation Threshold	80%
Liquidation Bonus	5%
Reserve Factor	10%
Liquidation Protocol Fee	0.1
Borrow Cap	600k
Supply Cap	1,100k
Debt Ceiling	N/A
Base	0%
Slope1	4%
Uoptimal	90%
Slope2	64%
Disclaimer
The Aave-Chan Initiative is not linked nor paid by QiDAO to publish this AFRC

The ACI supports stablecoin diversity as part of its delegate platform.

Marc Zeller, the founder of ACI, owns some vQI, an LSD of QI, the native asset of QiDAO.

Copyright
Copyright and related rights waived via CC0,

decision.summary: This proposal updates the risk parameters for OP asset in Aave V3 Optimism pool to enable borrowing and adjust caps to reflect L2 maturity, aiming to attract more suppliers and borrowers and generate protocol revenue.
key_arguments_for: Timeline voting metrics show unanimous early and stable support for YAE.
Historical similar proposals successfully updated parameters without negative market impact.
Forum comments from risk and protocol teams support the proposal with recommendations for cautious cap adjustments.
Market price and TVL impacts are positive post-event, suggesting favorable reception.
key_arguments_against: Some forum comments caution on supply cap size, recommending lowering to 5 million OP for risk management.
Two forum posts express negative sentiment, indicating some community concerns about risk.

evidence.quote: Support with cautious cap recommendations by ChaosLabs and Gauntlet; original proposal by Marc Zeller.
Stable and unanimous lead for YAE with 100% lead ratio by quartile.
Previous risk parameter updates showed no negative price or TVL impact, supporting change stance.

decision.ai_final_conclusion: Option 'YAE' selected with stance to keep 'Change'.
decision.ai_final_reason:
- Timeline analytics reveal unanimous early and sustained support for the YAE option, indicating strong community backing.
- Similar past proposals updating risk parameters (e.g., quarterly gas rebate and USDT collateral enablement) successfully passed and did not result in negative token price or TVL impacts, reinforcing the prudence of this change.
- Forum sentiment is moderately positive with expert endorsements and constructive critiques recommending conservative caps, reflecting a balanced community viewpoint.
- Market price and TVL have shown positive movements post-proposal, suggesting favorable adoption and protocol health.
- The recommendation aligns with forum sentiment overall, as the majority of informed comments support the proposal with cautious optimism.
- This choice optimizes long-term protocol growth while managing risk, supporting a change stance over status quo.
